channel.title: GetHashCode on Tearth's blog
channel.description: Recent content in GetHashCode on Tearth's blog

item.title: GetHashCode inside CLR: Reference types
item.description: GetHashCode, a part of the Object class, is one of the key method present in every class instance. Its main purpose is to calculate and return a number associated with the specified object, which will be used as hash (a very good example is Dictionary class). This article will be split into two parts: the first one will focus on the reference types and the second one on the value types. We will focus on the internal implementation of CLR and try to figure out how exactly the hash code for reference and value types is generated.
